sen.j: 北野駅（きたのえき）は、かつて京都府京都市の京福電気鉄道北野線に存在した鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Kitano Station was a stop on the Kitano Line operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., which was located in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 京都電燈が路線を建設した際、終着駅として開設した駅である。
sen.e: Kitano Station was opened as a terminal when the Kyoto Dento built a railway line.
Kitano Station opened as a terminal when the Kyoto Dento built a railway line.
Kitano Station opened as a terminal when the Kyoto Dento, an electric power company, built a railway line.
sen.cmt: 京都電燈→Kyoto Dento, an electric power company としました。

sen.j: 北野天満宮の南側にあたり、頭端式ホーム2面3線の配線となっていた。
sen.e: The station was located to the south of Kitano Tenmangu Shrine and had two bay platforms serving three tracks.
The station was located to the south of Kitano Tenmangu Shrine and had two bay platforms serving three tracks.
The station was located to the south of Kitano Tenmangu Shrine and had two toothed platforms serving three tracks.
sen.cmt: 頭端式ホーム→toothed platforms としました。

sen.j: 駅舎は木造の簡易なものであった。
sen.e: The station building was a simple wooden building.
The station building was a simple wooden structure.
The station building was a simple wooden structure.

sen.j: のち、今出川通の拡張に伴い京都市電今出川線が北野紙屋川町から北野白梅町まで延伸されることになったため、京福電気鉄道北野線は北野白梅町－北野間を市電へ譲渡することになり、その際北野電停は市電のそれと統合されたため、京福の駅は廃駅となった。
sen.e: Later, as the Kyoto City Tram extended the Imadegawa Line, the section between Kitano-kamiyagawacho Station and Kitano-Hakubaicho Station, along with the expansion of the Imadegawa-dori Street, the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. transferred the Kitano Line that ran between Kitano-Hakubaicho Station and Kitano Station to the Kyoto City Tram; at the same time, Kitano Station operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad was merged into that operated by the Kyoto City Tram, thereby the station of the Keifuku Electric Railroad was abandoned.

sen.j: 駅跡には現在、仏教関係の施設が建てられている。
sen.e: On the site of the station, religious facilities are built.
Religious facilities now stand on the site of the former station.
